attrs.label: Postgres Image (CAUTION)
attrs.description:
If you are changing this after the postgres directory has been initialized,</br>
STOP! and make sure you have a backup of your data.</br>
Changing this will trigger an one way database upgrade.</br>
You can only select newer versions of postgres.</br>
Selecting an older version will refuse to start.</br>
If something goes wrong, you will have to restore from backup.

attrs.label: Default Admin User
attrs.description: The default admin user for FreshRSS.

attrs.label: Default Admin Password
attrs.description: The default admin password for FreshRSS.

attrs.label: Cron Min
attrs.description:
A valid cron expression for cron minutes.</br>
For example: */15 or */5 or 0,30

attrs.label: Database User
attrs.description: The user for the database.

attrs.label: Database Name
attrs.description: The name for the database.

attrs.label: Database Password
attrs.description: The password for FreshRSS.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions
attrs.description:
Automatically set permissions for the host path.
Enabling this, will check the top level directory,</br>
If it finds incorrect permissions, it will `chown` the
host path to the user and group required for the
postgres container.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)
